main event: An unidentified flying object was spotted over Biloxi, Mississippi on November 12, 1957 by ground radar.
interesting points: The object was described as 3 times brighter than a star and brighter than anything ever seen.
The object changed shape from round to flat on top.
The object exhibited erratic movement, going straight out and slightly to the right before going over the horizon.
The sighting was observed for approximately 45 minutes.
The observers were questioned and found to be sincere and reliable.
witnesses: Lt. George Funk, USAF and one civilian observer
photographs: yes, the report includes photographs and sketches
